meanings.sent1: The withholder refused to share his toys with the other children.
meanings.sent2: The withholder kept the secret to himself, not telling anyone.
meanings.sent3: The withholder hoarded all the candy, leaving none for the rest of the class.
meanings.sent4: She was a withholder of emotions, never revealing how she truly felt.
meanings.sent5: The withholder of information guarded the key to the mystery tightly.

meanings.definition: To hold back or refrain from giving or granting.
meanings.sent1: He would often withholder his approval, making others work harder for it.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to withholder bonuses until the end of the year.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to withholder the secret ingredient in his famous recipe.
meanings.sent4: She chose to withholder her opinion, not wanting to cause any conflict.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to withholder the test results until all students had finished.
